alert.note: Alert for Clark; Greene (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:41AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL CLARK AND GREENE COUNTIES THROUGH 515 AM EDT... At 441 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Englewood, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Kettering, Beavercreek, Huber Heights, Fairborn, Xenia, Bellbrook, New Carlisle, Yellow Springs, Wright-Patterson Afb, Cedarville, Enon, Jamestown, South Charleston, Wilberforce, Harmony, Lisbon, New Jasper, Spring Valley and South Vienna. This includes the following Interstates... I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 41 and 67. I-71 in Ohio near mile marker 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 AM EDT for central, southwestern and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
